channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped household items and clothing, 10th January
item.description:
Another popular dumping spot..the chair and children's toy and a couple of bags have been there for some time. More bags have appeared more recently. Please can these items be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dabbling Close, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Illegally parked car, 10th January
item.description:
Yet another illegally parked car at the same location. I see this area constantly used for wrong parking. I'm starting to think that the council is deliberately ignoring the reports. Anyways, I'll continue to file these reports every day or multiple times a day because this is how often cars are illegally parking at that spot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Wandsworth Road, Vauxhall, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On Grafton Way near the Huntley Street corner, 10th January
item.description:
We now have 2 of the 3 manholes at this location making noise. The loudest one is the single manhole which is beside the black car in my photo. The double manhole is also making noise but gets driven over less often.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Grafton Way, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter not picked up, 10th January
item.description:
Lots of litter at corner if street. Not picked up by the street sweepers/ cleaners. If not, why not? This is a public footpath. It looks horrendous

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chardmore Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Drain surround adjacent to Speed Hump collapsing, 10th January
item.description:
Due to locating a Speed Hump, which forces traffic to the extreme left of the road, vehicles are forced to run directly over the drain, which is collapsing - again! I reported this problem before, it was intially repaired extremely poorly, but then done properly. However, as I warned at the time, unless the adjacent speed hump is removed, or moved, vehicles will continue to drive directly over the drain and the problem will return, again and again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upton Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Genersl dumping ground, 10th January
item.description:
I have complained to Riverside ownersvof Carey Court, that their bins and flat clearance rubbish are always stacked against our property spilling over into our front garden. The rubbish often broken glass is on the street soilwd waste that misses the bin goes into our front garden. I have requested the Southwark Bins are place the opposite side of the car park of the car park as stacked against our block is a fire hazzard. And Southwarks food bin for Carey Court, next to our building atracting rats... is offensie. You dont stack them directly against your own blocks. This needs to be moved to opposite side of car park as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 140, Wyndham Road, Camberwell, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
